chapters.title: Chapter 2: Whirlpools in the Pattern
chapters.info: Haral Luhhan, p. 57 (40)—Blacksmith of Emond's Field. Perrin was his apprentice before he left home. He told Perrin that you cannot walk away from what has to be done—Perrin heeds this advice. He is a very large man, which works well for work at the forge. His wife, Alsbet, is almost as large as he is, and nearly as strong. See also Luhhan, Alsbet.
